meanings.definition: Not emphasized or accented in speech or music.
meanings.sent1: She spoke in an unstressed tone during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The background music was soft and unstressed.
meanings.sent3: The unstressed syllables in the poem added a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her unstressed voice blended seamlessly with the melody.
meanings.sent5: The unstressed notes in the song created a soothing atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: After the exam, she felt relaxed and unstressed.
meanings.sent2: He remained unstressed despite the tight deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed quite unstressed while napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her unstressed demeanor helped calm the tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The unstressed atmosphere in the park was perfect for unwinding.

meanings.sent1: The unstressed details were easily overlooked in the report.
meanings.sent2: Her role in the play was minor and unstressed.
meanings.sent3: The unstressed elements in the painting subtly enhanced its beauty.
meanings.sent4: His unstressed comments went unnoticed in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The unstressed background characters added depth to the story.
